posts.cooked:
Hey,

Here in the Netherlands they decided that 1 March would be the “step over to Signal day”. I’ve used WhatsApp for many years and had Signal but never used it actively.
People who don’t want to install Signal for any reason: SMS works too for them

I’ve been trying to move people over for the last weeks and announced that I am going to delete WhatsApp a few times. Today was the day, WhatsApp has been deleted from my phone.

I even got a Dutch news website so far to come to Signal.

There is a sad story to this, I do still have to use WhatsApp for my work, but that is via WhatsApp Business so everyone who sends me a message will receive an automatic message that contact via Signal is quicker. My username, a link to start a chat and a link to download Signal are included.

What is your reason to use Signal and not for example WhatsApp?

posts.name: Nikos
posts.cooked: Hello there. Great news from Netherlands… Well done to all! Personally, I hate Meta and Google so far. So that’s your answer. I hope someday that Greece, my country, will follow your example as well. Here, for years, Viber is the most popular chatting platform unfortunately. I have tried continuously to get people over Signal but it’s too difficult here believe me…

Megan:

What is your reason to use Signal and not for example WhatsApp?

Privacy and high data protection.
With the green top dog, you become a product with your data.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked: Well sms is far worse than Wgatsapp, and I plan on keep using both. Some people just won’t switch. And some employers are using it too (better than Teams…) so I have no choice.

anon53652:

Well sms is far worse than Wgatsapp,

i’m not so sure, sms may have huge load of third party data collectors, but one is missing, meta inc.
Disagreed. SMS is much safer than Meta stuff.

I deleted WhatsApp – and if I remember correctly – that was a good three years ago. That was shortly after the company said (possibly only in Germany, but I think it was basically the EU) that you had to agree to some new terms of service. But that was not really comprehensible to anyone. It was already clear, however, that by using this messenger, you were paying for the extraction of all kinds of private data.

I then switched to Signal and think it’s perfectly ok to donate something to the people who work on Signal from time to time. In the meantime, I have also convinced one or two people to get out of WhatsApp completely.

It’s enough to make you shudder when you see how this Mr. Zuckerberg throws himself at the feet of this new president, completely submissive, donating a lot of money (in German there is a much more fitting description for such behavior), and at the same time announcing the end of fact-checking.

We can only recommend that everyone give this gentleman, and many others who behave similarly to him, a clear answer.
I’m currently trying to get more people over.

Ik wens je veel succes hiermee - en ook dat je binnenkort in het Nederlands kunt communiceren in plaats van in het Engels. (Helaas moest ik het laten vertalen).

Ik heb net even op (nederlandse) websites gekeken voor de nationale stap-over-op signal dag: Dat is geweldig, wie heeft dat voor je georganiseerd?

Megan:

What is your reason to use Signal and not for example WhatsApp?

I haven’t and will not use WhatsApp, nor anything associated with Facebook (nor Google, when I can help it). I use Signal partly out of principle – a man doesn’t need to have a reason to carry a pocket knife, so to speak. But also, Signal or an equivalent really is a necessity for discussing personal things by message, for example financial or medical stuff with family. The principle is I don’t have to explain. And something is wrong when it’s assumed I can have no acceptable explanation.

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked:
Three reasons:

“My life is my own…”

“I am not a number, I am a free man!”

leading to the third reason which piggybacks off a Reddit user’s idea of marketing ad for Signal. And I still think is the best embodiment possible of what the encrypted messenger stands for: Being inside of fast food joint or restaurant of your choice, connected to their public WI-FI with various transmissions of public data filling up the place, ranging from extremely sensitive to mundane and then the camera moving to you. Nothing coming from your phone/laptop/tablet but encrypted noise even as you get up to leave. Then as you exit? “That’s why I use Signal.”

I can be who the I am and even my most mundane thoughts or chatting are between me and those I trust enough to share them with.

@xJustxMegx This was exactly me in 2020 and 2021. The movement started after I deleted WhatsApp. Some of my dearest friends came with me, some friends were okay with iMessage, but my family… damn. My family was mad and frustrated. They thought I was hiding in a shell and didn’t want to communicate with them anymore.

After trying to explain myself multiple times. After a year of hating SMS, they finally made the switch, some still with resistance, but they did it. And I was proud. Not necessarily of the path itself or how I accomplished this, but I was, and still am, proud that I finally had the guts to stand up for something I believe in, to fight for it, and not to follow the masses like a simple sheep.

And now? I don’t hear anyone complaining about having two separate apps. And now? There’s even a big movement happening, and I am no longer alone on Signal and have almost all my personal chats in Signal. Now, I am still waiting for the day I can move my business chats to Signal. When they finally make it possible to switch accounts or release a Signal Business app in the App Store. I am really hoping for that day!

posts.name: Wouter Maas
posts.cooked: I have note deleted WA yet, as too many people have not been migrated yet, but also Signal is lacking the web version… Since I am working a lot behind a computer (of an employer) the desktop version is not allowed, hence I would need a web version. Any ideas when this might be developed?

@Brigitte13e some of my friends did come and others did not. They can join me on Signal or they can SMS me. Their choice.

One day more people will use Signal instead of WhatsApp.

@Wouter_Maas welcome to the community! The only thing I can find about a web version currently is this: Web.signal.org?

What is the reason you’re not allowed to use the desktop version?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It should still be able to install.
Back in the day in high school, when we couldn’t install programs on school computers, we installed them on our own USB sticks!

Oh good old times. I remember that I had administrator account at my high school (MBO) because I was in the student council.

I had access to everyone’s documents and was able to install programs on the computer that way. I never abused it and never told anyone.

posts.name: Wouter Maas
posts.cooked: I am only allowed to install microsoft verified apps on the work laptop…
And your IT department can’t do it for you?

posts.name: Wouter Maas
posts.cooked: nope as it is private and not work related…
